Software

Music

I use ncmcpp as my music client together with Mopidy.

Mopidy has an amazing collection of plugins where you can basically combine music from Youtube, Spotify and Soundcloud into one central music player. I don’t like saving music to my hard-drive anymore so this basically perfect.

Browser

qutebrowser for most of my browsing needs. The browser has vim keybindings and a lot of customising options with a configuration file. I don’t personally have any crazy shortcuts set but it’s there.

Document Writing

I use LateX for all of my academic papers.

Music Production

FL Studio is the program I’m most familiar and basically, enjoy. Sadly, there are no sensible Linux alternatives for music production. I have given a try to programs like MusE and Ardour but they just can’t beat the ease of use of FL Studio.

Font

My favorite font has to be Cozette. It looks great on any context, plus it includes glyphs compatible with ranger-icons. Most people will tell you bitmap fonts are only good for ricing but they are definetely wrong. Let them keep using Source Code Pro.

Terminal Emulator

Text Editor
